$!You must tell DVLA if you have fits.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in the FEP1 questionnaire and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘FEP1 Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 247KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_178630.pdf "Download ‘FEP1 Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 247KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in the FEP1V questionnaire and send to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘FEP1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 340KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_185934.pdf "Download ‘FEP1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 340KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: Fits are a medical condition you must tell DVLA about
title: Fits and driving
